intro: Lisianthius ovalis, commonly known as the oval lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and forest edges. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
